intro: Cichorium saticum var. crispum, commonly known as curly endive, is a leafy vegetable characterized by its curly, frilly leaves that range in color from light green to dark green. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and lettuces, and is native to Europe and parts of Asia. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers cool climates and well-drained soil. Its leaves are often used in salads, soups, and as a bittering agent in various culinary dishes.
